game.views

Class TalonPileView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • framework.core.mvc.view.PanelView
              • game.views.AbstractPileView
                • game.views.TalonPileView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    framework.api.IView, framework.communication.internal.signal.ISignalListener, framework.core.graphics.IRenderer, framework.core.physics.ICollidable, IUndoable, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public final class TalonPileView
extends AbstractPileView
implements framework.core.physics.ICollidable
    This views represents the talon pile view. This view will display cards whenever the user clicks on the Stock view. This view will adapt itself based on the options set (draw three vs. draw one)
    Author:
    Daniel Ricci <thedanny09@icloud.com>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • isPhaseOne

        public boolean isPhaseOne()
        Returns:
        TRUE if the pile style has not yet gone through 4 cards, FALSE otherwise

      • isPhaseTwo

        public boolean isPhaseTwo()
        Returns:
        TRUE if the pile style has not yet gone through 14 cards, FALSE otherwise

      • isDeckPlayed

        public boolean isDeckPlayed()
        Returns:
        TRUE if the Talon has been played through fully, FALSE otherwise

      • isTalonEnded

        public boolean isTalonEnded()
        Returns:
        TRUE if the Talon has gone through the specified number of deck shuffles (based on the options preferences currently set), FALSE otherwise
